profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-10-20 14:02:49 -0700.

did.abstract: William B. Adams was professor of Theater Arts at UCLA. The collection consists of materials relating to the production of Adams' book, Handbook of motion picture production (c. 1977).
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William B. Adams Papers (Collection 1205). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: William B. Adams was professor of Theater Arts at UCLA; published Handbook of motion picture production (c. 1977).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of materials relating to the production of Adams's book, Handbook of motion picture production (c. 1977). Includes drafts of the manuscript, page proofs, galley proofs, original illustrations, a copy of the book and correspondence.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Manuscripts (Boxes 1-2).
Illustrations file, rough sketches, early proof (Boxes 2-3).
Camera-ready art, preface draft, photocopy, printed book, correspondence (Box 4, pambind).

controlaccess.subject: Motion pictures -- Production and direction -- Archives.
controlaccess.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Department of Theater Arts--Faculty -- Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This includes those original typescript pages that survived pasteup revisions at the typewriter. Author's original sketches were put in the text at the time of writing.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A complete typescript original never actually existed because pasteup revisions were put directly into photocopy.

did.physdesc: Two copies (2 parts each) of xerox copies.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Used by author and art director for scaling, labeling, and checking.

did.unittitle: Copy-edited manuscript from which the type was set.
Complete manuscript in page proofs as proofread by the author.
Galley proofs as proof by the author.
Author's rough sketches and pasteups made during writing the text.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Many of these were later omitted.

did.unittitle: Rough sketches of illustrations made by the author for the art director.
Early proof used to indicate the size and style of type.
Superseded intermediate material used in organizing revisions.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Superseded as the manuscript was revised.

did.unittitle: Photocopy made for author to work out a revision after page proofs had been printed.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Publisher's editorial supervisor made the final camera-ready revision.

did.unittitle: Printed book: Handbook of Motion Picture Production, 1st edition.
